intro: Oreopanax gnaphalocephalus, commonly known as the mountain sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its woody stem and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by spherical berries. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
